intro: Pelecyphora sneedii subsp. sneedii, commonly known as the Sneed's pelecyphora, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a low-growing habit, which help it conserve moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
